abstract_summ: Recent research to assess the magnitude of mental health outcomes and associated factors among health care workers treating patients exposed to COVID‐19 in China has found that many are psychologically stressed, raising concerns about the psychological well‐being of physicians and nurses involved in the acute COVID‐19 outbreak.• The World Health Organization (WHO) guidelines needs to be empirically examined.(PsycInfo Database Record (c) 2020 APA, all rights reserved).During the COVID-19 pandemic, Spain ranked 1st in number of infected health workers.This paper discusses how positive emotions can help maintain and improve mental health during the COVID-19 outbreak, taking into account examples of social interaction and positive psychology research efforts in Japanese context.This article mainly summarized the causes, clinical manifestations and preventive measures of COVID-19 impact on psychology of Chinese people, and presented two representative cases at the same time.(PsycInfo Database Record (c) 2020 APA, all rights reserved).This short piece is a reflection on some of the stark cultural, social, and official differences between Australian and Jordanian handling of the mental health crisis triggered by COVID-19 seen through the eyes of two researchers living in the 2 countries.
title_summ: Mental health status and coping strategy of medical workers in China during The COVID-19 outbreakNAATP on telemedicine and a ‘disease of isolation’COVID19 and DepressionEating disorders in the age of COVID-19Coping With COVID-19: Learning From Past Pandemics to Avoid Pitfalls and PanicPsychological distress found among exposed health care workersThe association of being in quarantine and related COVID-19 recommended and non-recommended behaviors with psychological distress in Chinese populationThe Psychological Impact of COVID-19 on Chinese IndividualsCOVID-19 AnxietyGendered mental health interventions for health care workers in Spain during COVID-19.Laughing it off: Coronavirus superspreaders, anxiety, and fear in Jordan and Australia.Role of focusing on the positive side during COVID-19 outbreak: Mental health perspective from positive psychology.Are women still "the other"?
title_abstract_phrases: Psychological distress found among exposed health care workersRecent research to assess the magnitude of mental health outcomes and associated factors among health care workers treating patients exposed to COVID‐19 in China has found that many are psychologically stressed, raising concerns about the psychological well‐being of physicians and nurses involved in the acute COVID‐19 outbreak.Gendered mental health interventions for health care workers in Spain during COVID-19.During the COVID-19 pandemic, Spain ranked 1st in number of infected health workers.This paper discusses how positive emotions can help maintain and improve mental health during the COVID-19 outbreak, taking into account examples of social interaction and positive psychology research efforts in Japanese context.Role of focusing on the positive side during COVID-19 outbreak: Mental health perspective from positive psychology.This article mainly summarized the causes, clinical manifestations and preventive measures of COVID-19 impact on psychology of Chinese people, and presented two representative cases at the same time.
